About

I am an undergraduate Mechanical Engineer (PCCOE, 2023â€“27) focused on vehicle dynamics, FEA-driven design, and practical manufacturing. I combine mechanical systems thinking with embedded prototyping (Arduino / microcontrollers) and cloud dashboards to prototype, test and iterate physical systems faster. Recent work spans brake-disc FEA optimization, suspension & steering calculations, and manufacturing using lathe, VMC and M1TR processes.

Projects

Team Kratos Racing (Formula Bharat 2025)

Brake disc optimization and suspension design for EV race car.

Role: Vehicle Dynamics & Manufacturing

Contributed to the dynamics and manufacturing of Thunderblade 5.0 â€” an all-electric Formula-Student race car. Performed FEA-based brake disc optimization (14 % weight reduction) using ANSYS, suspension geometry and steering-system calculations. Oversaw fabrication using lathe, M1TR and VMC, and supported composite monocoque manufacturing.

DriveEdge â€” Autonomous Prototype (IIT Bombay Techfest)

Arduino-based self-driving vehicle for obstacle detection and lane following.

Focus: Embedded Systems & Control

Designed a compact Arduino-based robotic car featuring ultrasonic obstacle detection, line-tracking sensors, and PID control for steering stability. Implemented efficient motor control and sensor-fusion logic for reliable navigation.

Smart Gas Cylinder Trolley

IoT-enabled system to monitor gas level and send low-alert SMS.

Highlights: Developed a load-sensor-based weighing platform with GSM alert system. Calibrated 6 kg strain-gauge sensor, displayed readings on LCD, and automated SMS alerts for refilling thresholds.

SmartCycle Rear Light System

Microcontroller-controlled LED indicator and brake light for bicycles.

Design: Built an Arduino-controlled 8Ã—8 LED matrix tail-light system with handlebar switch controls for turn signals and brake intensity. Implemented PWM-based dimming and low-power operation.
